trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Custom installation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Custom installation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This document details the custom installation options for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This document details the custom installation options for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Custom installation of Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Custom installation of Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: The following documentation provides information on using the custom installation option for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: The following documentation provides information on using the custom installation option for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: You can use this option if you have additional configuration options or need optional features that are not covered in the express installation.
trans-unit.target: You can use this option if you have additional configuration options or need optional features that are not covered in the express installation.

trans-unit.source: Related documentation
trans-unit.target: Related documentation

trans-unit.source: If you did not read the documentation on [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md), the following table provides links to related topics.
trans-unit.target: If you did not read the documentation on [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md), the following table provides links to related topics.

trans-unit.source: The first three topics in bold are required before you start the installation.
trans-unit.target: The first three topics in bold are required before you start the installation.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.target: Install using Express settings

trans-unit.target: Express installation of Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.target: Upgrade from DirSync

trans-unit.target: Upgrade from Azure AD sync tool (DirSync)

trans-unit.target: After installation

trans-unit.source: Verify the installation and assign licenses
trans-unit.target: Verify the installation and assign licenses

trans-unit.source: Install required components
trans-unit.target: Install required components

trans-unit.source: When you install the synchronization services, you can leave the optional configuration section unchecked and Azure AD Connect will set everything up automatically.
trans-unit.target: When you install the synchronization services, you can leave the optional configuration section unchecked and Azure AD Connect will set everything up automatically.

trans-unit.source: This includes setting up a SQL Server 2012 Express instance and creating the appropriate groups and assigning them permissions.
trans-unit.target: This includes setting up a SQL Server 2012 Express instance and creating the appropriate groups and assigning them permissions.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to change the defaults you can use the table below to understand the optional configuration options that are available.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to change the defaults you can use the table below to understand the optional configuration options that are available.

trans-unit.source: Required Components
trans-unit.target: Required Components

trans-unit.source: Optional Configuration
trans-unit.target: Optional Configuration

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Name
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Name

trans-unit.source: Allows you to specify the SQL Server name and the instance name.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to specify the SQL Server name and the instance name.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option if you already have a database server that you would like to use.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option if you already have a database server that you would like to use.

trans-unit.source: Service Account
trans-unit.target: Service Account

trans-unit.source: By default Azure AD Connect will create a local service account for the synchronization services to use.
trans-unit.target: By default Azure AD Connect will create a local service account for the synchronization services to use.

trans-unit.source: The password is generated automatically and unknown to the person installing Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: The password is generated automatically and unknown to the person installing Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you use a remote SQL server you need a service account in the domain and know the password.
trans-unit.target: If you use a remote SQL server you need a service account in the domain and know the password.

trans-unit.source: In those cases, enter the service account to use.
trans-unit.target: In those cases, enter the service account to use.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the user running the installation is an SA in SQL so a login for the service account can be created.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the user running the installation is an SA in SQL so a login for the service account can be created.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#custom-settings-installation)
trans-unit.target: See [Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#custom-settings-installation)

trans-unit.source: Permissions
trans-unit.target: Permissions

trans-unit.source: By default Azure AD Connect will create four groups local to the server when the synchronization services are installed.
trans-unit.target: By default Azure AD Connect will create four groups local to the server when the synchronization services are installed.

trans-unit.source: These groups are: Administrators group, Operators group, Browse group, and the Password Reset Group.
trans-unit.target: These groups are: Administrators group, Operators group, Browse group, and the Password Reset Group.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to specify your own groups you can do so here.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to specify your own groups you can do so here.

trans-unit.source: The groups must be local on the server and cannot be located in the domain.
trans-unit.target: The groups must be local on the server and cannot be located in the domain.

trans-unit.source: User sign-in
trans-unit.target: User sign-in

trans-unit.source: After installing the required components you will be asked to specify how the single sign-on method that users will use.
trans-unit.target: After installing the required components you will be asked to specify how the single sign-on method that users will use.

trans-unit.source: The table below provides a brief description of the available options.
trans-unit.target: The table below provides a brief description of the available options.

trans-unit.source: For a full description of the sign-in methods, see [User sign-in](active-directory-aadconnect-user-signin.md).
trans-unit.target: For a full description of the sign-in methods, see [User sign-in](active-directory-aadconnect-user-signin.md).

trans-unit.source: User Signin
trans-unit.target: User Signin

trans-unit.source: Single Sign On option
trans-unit.target: Single Sign On option

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Password Sync
trans-unit.target: Password Sync

trans-unit.source: Users will be able to sign into Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365, Dynamics CRM, and Windows InTune, using the same password as they use when logging into their on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Users will be able to sign into Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365, Dynamics CRM, and Windows InTune, using the same password as they use when logging into their on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: The user's password is synchronized to Azure via a password hash and authentication occurs in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The user's password is synchronized to Azure via a password hash and authentication occurs in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: See [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Federation with AD FS
trans-unit.target: Federation with AD FS

trans-unit.source: Users will be able to sign into Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365, Dynamics CRM, and Windows InTune, using the same password as they use when logging into their on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Users will be able to sign into Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365, Dynamics CRM, and Windows InTune, using the same password as they use when logging into their on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: The users are redirected to their on-premises ad fs instance for signing in and authentication is done on-premises.
trans-unit.target: The users are redirected to their on-premises ad fs instance for signing in and authentication is done on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Do not configure
trans-unit.target: Do not configure

trans-unit.source: Neither feature will be installed and configured.
trans-unit.target: Neither feature will be installed and configured.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option if you already have a 3rd party federation server or another existing solution in place.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option if you already have a 3rd party federation server or another existing solution in place.

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: On the Connect to Azure AD screen, enter a global admin account and password.
trans-unit.target: On the Connect to Azure AD screen, enter a global admin account and password.

trans-unit.source: Make sure this account does not have multi-factor authentication enabled.
trans-unit.target: Make sure this account does not have multi-factor authentication enabled.

trans-unit.source: This will cause it to fail authentication.
trans-unit.target: This will cause it to fail authentication.

trans-unit.source: This account is only used to create a service account in Azure AD and is not used after the wizard has completed.
trans-unit.target: This account is only used to create a service account in Azure AD and is not used after the wizard has completed.

trans-unit.source: User Signin
trans-unit.target: User Signin

trans-unit.source: Pages under the section Sync
trans-unit.target: Pages under the section Sync

trans-unit.source: Connect your directories
trans-unit.target: Connect your directories

trans-unit.source: To connect to your Active Directory Domain Service, Azure AD Connect needs the credentials of an account with sufficient permissions.
trans-unit.target: To connect to your Active Directory Domain Service, Azure AD Connect needs the credentials of an account with sufficient permissions.

trans-unit.source: This account can be a regular user account because it only needs the default read permissions.
trans-unit.target: This account can be a regular user account because it only needs the default read permissions.

trans-unit.source: However, depending on your scenario, you may need additional permissions.
trans-unit.target: However, depending on your scenario, you may need additional permissions.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Azure AD Connect Accounts and permissions](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#create-the-ad-ds-account)
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Azure AD Connect Accounts and permissions](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#create-the-ad-ds-account)

trans-unit.source: User Signin
trans-unit.target: User Signin

trans-unit.source: Uniquely identifying your users
trans-unit.target: Uniquely identifying your users

trans-unit.source: The Matching across forests feature allows you to define how users from your AD DS forests are represented in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The Matching across forests feature allows you to define how users from your AD DS forests are represented in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A user might either be represented only once across all forests or have a combination of enabled and disabled accounts.
trans-unit.target: A user might either be represented only once across all forests or have a combination of enabled and disabled accounts.

trans-unit.source: User Signin
trans-unit.target: User Signin

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: My users are only represented once across all forests
trans-unit.target: My users are only represented once across all forests

trans-unit.source: All users are created as individual objects in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: All users are created as individual objects in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The objects are not joined in the metaverse.
trans-unit.target: The objects are not joined in the metaverse.

trans-unit.source: Mail attribute
trans-unit.target: Mail attribute

trans-unit.source: This option joins users and contacts if the mail attribute has the same value in different forests.
trans-unit.target: This option joins users and contacts if the mail attribute has the same value in different forests.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use this option when your contacts have been created using GALSync.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use this option when your contacts have been created using GALSync.

trans-unit.source: ObjectSID and msExchangeMasterAccountSID
trans-unit.target: ObjectSID and msExchangeMasterAccountSID

trans-unit.source: This option joins an enabled user in an account forest with a disabled user in an Exchange resource forest.
trans-unit.target: This option joins an enabled user in an account forest with a disabled user in an Exchange resource forest.

trans-unit.source: This is also known as linked mailbox in Exchange.
trans-unit.target: This is also known as linked mailbox in Exchange.

trans-unit.source: This option can also be used if you only use Lync and Exchange is not present in the resource forest.
trans-unit.target: This option can also be used if you only use Lync and Exchange is not present in the resource forest.

trans-unit.source: sAMAccountName and MailNickName
trans-unit.target: sAMAccountName and MailNickName

trans-unit.source: This option joins on attributes where it is expected the login ID for the user can be found.
trans-unit.target: This option joins on attributes where it is expected the login ID for the user can be found.

trans-unit.source: My own attribute
trans-unit.target: My own attribute

trans-unit.source: This option allows you to select your own attribute.
trans-unit.target: This option allows you to select your own attribute.

trans-unit.source: **Limitation:** Make sure to pick an attribute which will already exist in the metaverse.
trans-unit.target: **Limitation:** Make sure to pick an attribute which will already exist in the metaverse.

trans-unit.source: If you pick a custom attribute the wizard will not be able to complete.
trans-unit.target: If you pick a custom attribute the wizard will not be able to complete.

trans-unit.source: **Source Anchor** - The attribute sourceAnchor is an attribute which is immutable during the lifetime of a user object.
trans-unit.target: **Source Anchor** - The attribute sourceAnchor is an attribute which is immutable during the lifetime of a user object.

trans-unit.source: It is the primary key linking the on-premises user with the user in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: It is the primary key linking the on-premises user with the user in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Since the attribute cannot be changed, you must plan for a good attribute to use.
trans-unit.target: Since the attribute cannot be changed, you must plan for a good attribute to use.

trans-unit.source: A good candidate is objectGUID.
trans-unit.target: A good candidate is objectGUID.

trans-unit.source: This attribute will not change unless the user account is moved between forests/domains.
trans-unit.target: This attribute will not change unless the user account is moved between forests/domains.

trans-unit.source: In a multi-forest environment where you move accounts between forests, another attribute must be used, such as an attribute with the employeeID.
trans-unit.target: In a multi-forest environment where you move accounts between forests, another attribute must be used, such as an attribute with the employeeID.

trans-unit.source: Attributes to avoid are those which would change if a person marries or change assignments.
trans-unit.target: Attributes to avoid are those which would change if a person marries or change assignments.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use attributes with an @-sign, so email and userPrincipalName cannot be used.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use attributes with an @-sign, so email and userPrincipalName cannot be used.

trans-unit.source: The attribute is also case sensitive so if you move an object between forests, make sure to preserve the upper/lower case.
trans-unit.target: The attribute is also case sensitive so if you move an object between forests, make sure to preserve the upper/lower case.

trans-unit.source: For binary attributes the value is base64-encoded, but for other attribute types it will remain in its un-encoded state.
trans-unit.target: For binary attributes the value is base64-encoded, but for other attribute types it will remain in its un-encoded state.

trans-unit.source: In federation scenarios and some Azure AD interfaces this attribute is also known as immutableID.
trans-unit.target: In federation scenarios and some Azure AD interfaces this attribute is also known as immutableID.

trans-unit.source: More information about the source anchor can be found in the [design concepts](active-directory-aadconnect-design-concepts.md#sourceAnchor).
trans-unit.target: More information about the source anchor can be found in the [design concepts](active-directory-aadconnect-design-concepts.md#sourceAnchor).

trans-unit.source: **UserPrincipalName** - The attribute userPrincipalName is the attribute users will use when they login to Azure AD and Office 365.
trans-unit.target: **UserPrincipalName** - The attribute userPrincipalName is the attribute users will use when they login to Azure AD and Office 365.

trans-unit.source: The domains used, also known as the UPN-suffix, should be verified in Azure AD before the users are synchronized.
trans-unit.target: The domains used, also known as the UPN-suffix, should be verified in Azure AD before the users are synchronized.

trans-unit.source: It is strongly recommended to keep the default attribute userPrincipalName.
trans-unit.target: It is strongly recommended to keep the default attribute userPrincipalName.

trans-unit.source: If this attribute is non-routable and cannot be verified then it is possible to select another attribute, for example email, as the attribute holding the login ID.
trans-unit.target: If this attribute is non-routable and cannot be verified then it is possible to select another attribute, for example email, as the attribute holding the login ID.

trans-unit.source: This is known as **Alternate ID**.
trans-unit.target: This is known as **Alternate ID**.

trans-unit.source: The Alternate ID attribute value must follow the RFC822 standard.
trans-unit.target: The Alternate ID attribute value must follow the RFC822 standard.

trans-unit.source: An Alternate ID can be used with both password Single Sign-On (SSO) and federation SSO as the sign-in solution.
trans-unit.target: An Alternate ID can be used with both password Single Sign-On (SSO) and federation SSO as the sign-in solution.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Using an Alternate ID is not compatible with all Office 365 workloads.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Using an Alternate ID is not compatible with all Office 365 workloads.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please refer to [Configuring Alternate Login ID](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn659436.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, please refer to [Configuring Alternate Login ID](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn659436.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Sync filtering based on groups
trans-unit.target: Sync filtering based on groups

trans-unit.source: The filtering on groups feature allows you to run a small pilot where only a small subset of objects should be created in Azure AD and Office 365.
trans-unit.target: The filtering on groups feature allows you to run a small pilot where only a small subset of objects should be created in Azure AD and Office 365.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature, created a group in your Active Directory and add the users and groups which should be synchronized with Azure AD as direct members.
trans-unit.target: To use this feature, created a group in your Active Directory and add the users and groups which should be synchronized with Azure AD as direct members.

trans-unit.source: You can later add and remove users to this group to maintain the list of objects which should be present in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: You can later add and remove users to this group to maintain the list of objects which should be present in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature, in the customized path you will see this page:
trans-unit.target: To use this feature, in the customized path you will see this page:

trans-unit.source: Sync Filtering
trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] This feature is only intended to support a pilot deployment and should not be used in a full-blow production deployment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] This feature is only intended to support a pilot deployment and should not be used in a full-blow production deployment.

trans-unit.source: Optional Features
trans-unit.target: Optional Features

trans-unit.source: This screen allows you to select the optional features for your specific scenarios.
trans-unit.target: This screen allows you to select the optional features for your specific scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Below are brief explanations of each of the individual features.
trans-unit.target: Below are brief explanations of each of the individual features.

trans-unit.source: Optional features
trans-unit.target: Optional features

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If you currently have DirSync or Azure AD Sync active, do not activate any of the writeback features in Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If you currently have DirSync or Azure AD Sync active, do not activate any of the writeback features in Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Optional Features
trans-unit.target: Optional Features

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Exchange Hybrid Deployment
trans-unit.target: Exchange Hybrid Deployment

trans-unit.source: The Exchange Hybrid Deployment feature allows for the co-existence of Exchange mailboxes both on-premises and in Azure by synchronizing a specific set of [attributes](active-directory-aadconnectsync-attributes-synchronzied.md#exchange-hybrid-writeback) from Azure AD back into your on-premises directory.
trans-unit.target: The Exchange Hybrid Deployment feature allows for the co-existence of Exchange mailboxes both on-premises and in Azure by synchronizing a specific set of [attributes](active-directory-aadconnectsync-attributes-synchronzied.md#exchange-hybrid-writeback) from Azure AD back into your on-premises directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD app and attribute filtering
trans-unit.target: Azure AD app and attribute filtering

trans-unit.source: By enabling Azure AD app and attribute filtering, the set of synchronized attributes can be tailored to a specific set on a subsequent page of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: By enabling Azure AD app and attribute filtering, the set of synchronized attributes can be tailored to a specific set on a subsequent page of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: This opens two additional configuration pages in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: This opens two additional configuration pages in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Password synchronization
trans-unit.target: Password synchronization

trans-unit.source: You can enable this option if you selected federation as the sign-in solution.
trans-unit.target: You can enable this option if you selected federation as the sign-in solution.

trans-unit.source: Password synchronization can then be used as a backup option.
trans-unit.target: Password synchronization can then be used as a backup option.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md).

trans-unit.source: Password writeback
trans-unit.target: Password writeback

trans-unit.source: By enabling password writeback, password changes that originate with Azure AD will be written back to your on-premises directory.
trans-unit.target: By enabling password writeback, password changes that originate with Azure AD will be written back to your on-premises directory.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Getting started with password management](active-directory-passwords-getting-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Getting started with password management](active-directory-passwords-getting-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Group writeback
trans-unit.target: Group writeback

trans-unit.source: If you use the **Groups in Office 365** feature then you can have these groups in your on-premises Active Directory as a distribution group.
trans-unit.target: If you use the **Groups in Office 365** feature then you can have these groups in your on-premises Active Directory as a distribution group.

trans-unit.source: This option is only available if you have Exchange present in your on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This option is only available if you have Exchange present in your on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Group writeback](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#group-writeback).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Group writeback](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#group-writeback).

trans-unit.source: Device writeback
trans-unit.target: Device writeback

trans-unit.source: Allows you to writeback device objects in Azure AD to your on-premises Active Directory for conditional access scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to writeback device objects in Azure AD to your on-premises Active Directory for conditional access scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Enabling device writeback in Azure AD Connect](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-custom-device-writeback.md)
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Enabling device writeback in Azure AD Connect](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-custom-device-writeback.md)

trans-unit.source: Directory extension attribute sync
trans-unit.target: Directory extension attribute sync

trans-unit.source: By enabling directory extensions attribute sync, additional attributes specified will be synced to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: By enabling directory extensions attribute sync, additional attributes specified will be synced to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Directory extensions](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#directory-extensions).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Directory extensions](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#directory-extensions).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD app and attribute filtering
trans-unit.target: Azure AD app and attribute filtering

trans-unit.source: If you want to limit which attributes to synchronize to Azure AD, then start by selecting which services you are using, If you configure this page, any new service has to be selected explicitly by re-running the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: If you want to limit which attributes to synchronize to Azure AD, then start by selecting which services you are using, If you configure this page, any new service has to be selected explicitly by re-running the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: Optional features
trans-unit.target: Optional features

trans-unit.source: Based on the services selected in the previous step, this page will show all attributes which will be synchronized.
trans-unit.target: Based on the services selected in the previous step, this page will show all attributes which will be synchronized.

trans-unit.source: This list is a combination of all object types being synchronized.
trans-unit.target: This list is a combination of all object types being synchronized.

trans-unit.source: If there are some particular attributes you need to not synchronize, you can unselect those.
trans-unit.target: If there are some particular attributes you need to not synchronize, you can unselect those.

trans-unit.source: In the picture below the homePhone attribute has been unselected and will not synchronize to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: In the picture below the homePhone attribute has been unselected and will not synchronize to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Optional features
trans-unit.target: Optional features

trans-unit.source: Directory Extension attribute sync (preview)
trans-unit.target: Directory Extension attribute sync (preview)

trans-unit.source: With directory extensions you can extend the schema in Azure AD with custom attributes added by your organization or other attributes in Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: With directory extensions you can extend the schema in Azure AD with custom attributes added by your organization or other attributes in Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To use this feature select “Directory Extension attribute sync” on the “Optional Features” page.
trans-unit.target: To use this feature select “Directory Extension attribute sync” on the “Optional Features” page.

trans-unit.source: This will give you this page where you can select your additional attributes.
trans-unit.target: This will give you this page where you can select your additional attributes.

trans-unit.source: Sync Filtering
trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Directory extensions](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#directory-extensions).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Directory extensions](active-directory-aadconnect-feature-preview.md#directory-extensions).

trans-unit.source: Configuring federation with AD FS
trans-unit.target: Configuring federation with AD FS

trans-unit.source: Configuring AD FS with Azure AD Connect is simple with just a few clicks.
trans-unit.target: Configuring AD FS with Azure AD Connect is simple with just a few clicks.

trans-unit.source: The following is required prior to setup.
trans-unit.target: The following is required prior to setup.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Server 2012 R2 server for the federation server with remote management enabled
trans-unit.target: A Windows Server 2012 R2 server for the federation server with remote management enabled

trans-unit.source: A Windows Server 2012 R2 server for the Web Application Proxy server with remote management enabled
trans-unit.target: A Windows Server 2012 R2 server for the Web Application Proxy server with remote management enabled

trans-unit.source: An SSL certificate for the federation service name you intend to use (e.g. adfs.contoso.com)
trans-unit.target: An SSL certificate for the federation service name you intend to use (e.g. adfs.contoso.com)

trans-unit.source: Create a new AD FS farm or use an existing AD FS farm
trans-unit.target: Create a new AD FS farm or use an existing AD FS farm

trans-unit.source: You can use an existing AD FS farm or you can choose to create a new AD FS farm.
trans-unit.target: You can use an existing AD FS farm or you can choose to create a new AD FS farm.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to create a new one, you will be required to provide the SSL certificate.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to create a new one, you will be required to provide the SSL certificate.

trans-unit.source: If the SSL certificate is protected by a password, you will be prompted to provide the password.
trans-unit.target: If the SSL certificate is protected by a password, you will be prompted to provide the password.

trans-unit.source: AD FS Farm
trans-unit.target: AD FS Farm

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If you choose to use an existing AD FS farm, you will skip a few pages and be taken directly to a configuring the trust relationship between AD FS and Azure AD screen.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If you choose to use an existing AD FS farm, you will skip a few pages and be taken directly to a configuring the trust relationship between AD FS and Azure AD screen.

trans-unit.source: Specify the AD FS servers
trans-unit.target: Specify the AD FS servers

trans-unit.source: Here you will enter the specific servers that you want to install AD FS on.
trans-unit.target: Here you will enter the specific servers that you want to install AD FS on.

trans-unit.source: You can add one or more servers based on your capacity planning needs.
trans-unit.target: You can add one or more servers based on your capacity planning needs.

trans-unit.source: These servers must all be joined to an Active Directory domain prior to performing this configuration.
trans-unit.target: These servers must all be joined to an Active Directory domain prior to performing this configuration.

trans-unit.source: We recommend installing a single AD FS server for test and pilot deployments and deploying additional servers by opening up Azure AD Connect and deploying AD FS to additional servers to meet your scaling needs.
trans-unit.target: We recommend installing a single AD FS server for test and pilot deployments and deploying additional servers by opening up Azure AD Connect and deploying AD FS to additional servers to meet your scaling needs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Ensure that all of the servers are joined to an AD domain prior to performing this configuration.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Ensure that all of the servers are joined to an AD domain prior to performing this configuration.

trans-unit.source: AD FS Servers
trans-unit.target: AD FS Servers

trans-unit.source: Specify the Web Application Proxy servers
trans-unit.target: Specify the Web Application Proxy servers

trans-unit.source: Here you will enter the specific servers that you want as your Web Application proxy servers.
trans-unit.target: Here you will enter the specific servers that you want as your Web Application proxy servers.

trans-unit.source: The web application proxy server is deployed in your DMZ (extranet facing) and supports authentication requests from the extranet.
trans-unit.target: The web application proxy server is deployed in your DMZ (extranet facing) and supports authentication requests from the extranet.

trans-unit.source: You can add one or more servers based on your capacity planning needs.
trans-unit.target: You can add one or more servers based on your capacity planning needs.

trans-unit.source: We recommend installing a single Web Application proxy server for test and pilot deployments and deploying additional servers by opening up Azure AD Connect and deploying Web Application Proxy to additional servers.
trans-unit.target: We recommend installing a single Web Application proxy server for test and pilot deployments and deploying additional servers by opening up Azure AD Connect and deploying Web Application Proxy to additional servers.

trans-unit.source: We typically recommend having an equivalent number of proxy servers to satisfy authentication from the intranet.
trans-unit.target: We typically recommend having an equivalent number of proxy servers to satisfy authentication from the intranet.

trans-unit.source: If the account you are using to install Azure AD Connect is not a local admin on the AD FS server(s) then you will be prompted for credentials for an account that has sufficient permissions.
trans-unit.target: If the account you are using to install Azure AD Connect is not a local admin on the AD FS server(s) then you will be prompted for credentials for an account that has sufficient permissions.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that there is HTTP/HTTPS connectivity between the Azure AD Connect server and the Web Application Proxy server prior to configuring this step.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that there is HTTP/HTTPS connectivity between the Azure AD Connect server and the Web Application Proxy server prior to configuring this step.

trans-unit.source: In addition, ensure that there is HTTP/HTTPS connectivity between the Web Application Server and the AD FS server to allow authentication requests to flow through.
trans-unit.target: In addition, ensure that there is HTTP/HTTPS connectivity between the Web Application Server and the AD FS server to allow authentication requests to flow through.

trans-unit.source: Web App
trans-unit.target: Web App

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to enter credentials so that the web application server can establish a secure connection to the AD FS server.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to enter credentials so that the web application server can establish a secure connection to the AD FS server.

trans-unit.source: These credentials need to be a local administrator on the AD FS server.
trans-unit.target: These credentials need to be a local administrator on the AD FS server.

trans-unit.source: Proxy
trans-unit.target: Proxy

trans-unit.source: Specify the service account for the AD FS service
trans-unit.target: Specify the service account for the AD FS service

trans-unit.source: The AD FS service requires a domain service account to authenticate users and lookup user information in Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The AD FS service requires a domain service account to authenticate users and lookup user information in Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: It can support 2 types of service accounts:
trans-unit.target: It can support 2 types of service accounts:

trans-unit.source: **Group Managed Service Accounts** - This is a type of service account introduced in Active Directory Domain Service with Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: **Group Managed Service Accounts** - This is a type of service account introduced in Active Directory Domain Service with Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: This type of account provides services such as AD FS to use a single account without needing to update the account password on a regular basis.
trans-unit.target: This type of account provides services such as AD FS to use a single account without needing to update the account password on a regular basis.

trans-unit.source: Use this option if you already have Windows Server 2012 domain controllers in the domain that AD FS servers will belong to.
trans-unit.target: Use this option if you already have Windows Server 2012 domain controllers in the domain that AD FS servers will belong to.

trans-unit.source: **Domain User Account** - This type of account will require you to provide a password and regularly update the password when the password changes.
trans-unit.target: **Domain User Account** - This type of account will require you to provide a password and regularly update the password when the password changes.

trans-unit.source: Use this only when you do not have Windows Server 2012 domain controllers in the domain that AD FS servers will belong to.
trans-unit.target: Use this only when you do not have Windows Server 2012 domain controllers in the domain that AD FS servers will belong to.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect will auto create the group managed service account if you are logged in as a domain administrator.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect will auto create the group managed service account if you are logged in as a domain administrator.

trans-unit.source: AD FS Service Account
trans-unit.target: AD FS Service Account

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure AD domain that you wish to federate
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure AD domain that you wish to federate

trans-unit.source: This configuration is used to setup the federation relationship between AD FS and Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This configuration is used to setup the federation relationship between AD FS and Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: It configures AD FS to issue security tokens to Azure AD and configures Azure AD to trust the tokens from this specific AD FS instance.
trans-unit.target: It configures AD FS to issue security tokens to Azure AD and configures Azure AD to trust the tokens from this specific AD FS instance.

trans-unit.source: This page will only allow you to configure a single domain in the first time experience.
trans-unit.target: This page will only allow you to configure a single domain in the first time experience.

trans-unit.source: You can configure additional domains at any time by opening up Azure AD Connect again and performing this task.
trans-unit.target: You can configure additional domains at any time by opening up Azure AD Connect again and performing this task.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Domain
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Domain

trans-unit.source: Perform additional tasks to complete the federation configuration
trans-unit.target: Perform additional tasks to complete the federation configuration

trans-unit.source: The following additional tasks will need to be completed to finish the federation configuration.
trans-unit.target: The following additional tasks will need to be completed to finish the federation configuration.

trans-unit.source: Set up DNS records for the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) for both the intranet (your internal DNS server) and the extranet (public DNS through your domain registrar).
trans-unit.target: Set up DNS records for the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) for both the intranet (your internal DNS server) and the extranet (public DNS through your domain registrar).

trans-unit.source: For the intranet DNS record ensure that you use A records and not CNAME records.
trans-unit.target: For the intranet DNS record ensure that you use A records and not CNAME records.

trans-unit.source: This is required for windows authentication to work correctly from your domain joined machine.
trans-unit.target: This is required for windows authentication to work correctly from your domain joined machine.

trans-unit.source: If you are deploying more than one AD FS server or Web Application Proxy server, ensure that you have configured your load balancer and that the DNS records for the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) point to the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: If you are deploying more than one AD FS server or Web Application Proxy server, ensure that you have configured your load balancer and that the DNS records for the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) point to the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: For windows integrated authentication to work for browser applications using Internet Explorer in your intranet, ensure that the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) is added to the intranet zone in IE.
trans-unit.target: For windows integrated authentication to work for browser applications using Internet Explorer in your intranet, ensure that the AD FS federation service name (e.g. adfs.contoso.com) is added to the intranet zone in IE.

trans-unit.source: This can be controlled via group policy and deployed to all your domain joined computers.
trans-unit.target: This can be controlled via group policy and deployed to all your domain joined computers.

trans-unit.source: Optional configuration on your AD FS service
trans-unit.target: Optional configuration on your AD FS service

trans-unit.source: You can customize the illustration and logo image for your AD FS login pages by logging into the AD FS and using PSH to make this configuration.
trans-unit.target: You can customize the illustration and logo image for your AD FS login pages by logging into the AD FS and using PSH to make this configuration.

trans-unit.source: Configure and verify pages
trans-unit.target: Configure and verify pages

trans-unit.source: On this page the configuration will actually happen.
trans-unit.target: On this page the configuration will actually happen.

trans-unit.source: Staging mode
trans-unit.target: Staging mode

trans-unit.source: With staging mode the process to setup a new sync server in parallel with an existing server is possible.
trans-unit.target: With staging mode the process to setup a new sync server in parallel with an existing server is possible.

trans-unit.source: It is only supported to have one sync server connected to one directory in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: It is only supported to have one sync server connected to one directory in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: But if we want to move from another server, for example one running DirSync, then you can enable Azure AD Connect in staging mode.
trans-unit.target: But if we want to move from another server, for example one running DirSync, then you can enable Azure AD Connect in staging mode.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, the sync engine will import and synchronize data as normal, but it will not export anything to Azure AD and will turn off password sync and password writeback.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, the sync engine will import and synchronize data as normal, but it will not export anything to Azure AD and will turn off password sync and password writeback.

trans-unit.source: Sync Filtering
trans-unit.target: Sync Filtering

trans-unit.source: While in staging mode, it is possible to make required changes to the sync engine and review what is about to be exported.
trans-unit.target: While in staging mode, it is possible to make required changes to the sync engine and review what is about to be exported.

trans-unit.source: When the configuration looks good, run the installation wizard again and disable staging mode.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration looks good, run the installation wizard again and disable staging mode.

trans-unit.source: This will enable data to be exported to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This will enable data to be exported to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to disable the other server at the same time so only one server is actively exporting.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to disable the other server at the same time so only one server is actively exporting.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).

trans-unit.source: Verify your federation configuration
trans-unit.target: Verify your federation configuration

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect will verify the DNS settings for you when you click on the Verify button.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect will verify the DNS settings for you when you click on the Verify button.

trans-unit.source: Complete
trans-unit.target: Complete

trans-unit.source: In addition, perform the following verification steps:
trans-unit.target: In addition, perform the following verification steps:

trans-unit.source: Validate browser login from a domain joined machine from Internet Explorer from the intranet: Connect to https://myapps.microsoft.com and verify the login with your logged in account.
trans-unit.target: Validate browser login from a domain joined machine from Internet Explorer from the intranet: Connect to https://myapps.microsoft.com and verify the login with your logged in account.

trans-unit.source: Validate browser login from any device from the extranet: On a home machine or a mobile device, connect to https://myapps.microsoft.com and supply your login ID and your password credential.
trans-unit.target: Validate browser login from any device from the extranet: On a home machine or a mobile device, connect to https://myapps.microsoft.com and supply your login ID and your password credential.

trans-unit.source: Validate rich client login: Connect to https://testconnectivity.microsoft.com, choose the ‘Office 365’ tab and choose the ‘Office 365 Single Sign-On Test’.
trans-unit.target: Validate rich client login: Connect to https://testconnectivity.microsoft.com, choose the ‘Office 365’ tab and choose the ‘Office 365 Single Sign-On Test’.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After the installation has completed, sign out and sign in again to Windows before you use Synchronization Service Manager or Synchronization Rule Editor.
trans-unit.target: After the installation has completed, sign out and sign in again to Windows before you use Synchronization Service Manager or Synchronization Rule Editor.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have Azure AD Connect installed you can [verify the installation and assign licenses](active-directory-aadconnect-whats-next.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you have Azure AD Connect installed you can [verify the installation and assign licenses](active-directory-aadconnect-whats-next.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
